1.name: Intolerance: Love's Struggle Throughout the Ages
1.description: The story of a poor young woman, separated by prejudice from her husband and baby, is interwoven with tales of intolerance from throughout history.

2.name: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
2.description: Captain Nemo has built a fantastic submarine for his mission of revenge. He has traveled over 20,000 leagues in search of Charles Denver - a man who caused the death of Princess Daaker. ...                See full summary »

3.name: A Daughter of the Gods
3.description: A sultan agrees to help an wicked witch destroy a mysterious young lady, if the witch will bring his young son back from the dead with magic.

4.name: Where Are My Children?
4.description: A District Attorney's outspoken stand on abortion gets him in trouble with the local community.

7.name: Joan the Woman
7.description: A WWI English officer is inspired the night before a dangerous mission by a vision of Joan of Arc, whose story he relives.

8.name: Sherlock Holmes
8.description: When a couple of swindlers hold young Alice Faulkner against her will in order to discover the whereabouts of letters which could spell scandal for the royal family, Sherlock Holmes is on the case.

9.name: Judex
9.description: A twelve part serial following the adventures of the masked vigilante Judex as he fights against criminals led by the corrupt banker Favrauxom.

10.name: The Fall of a Nation
10.description: Three acts and a prologue. Act 1: A nation falls. Act 2: The heel of the conqueror. Act 3: The uprising two years later.

11.name: Vingarne
11.description: An adaptation of Herman Bang's 1902 novel "Mikaël." A sculptor befriends a young painter who becomes his model. Their friendship is thrown into turmoil when they both fall in love with the same woman.

12.name: Posle smerti
12.description: Andrei lives a secluded life with his aunt, studying and thinking about his now-deceased mother. His friend Tsenin is concerned, and tries to get Andrei to accompany him to social events. ...                See full summary »

13.description: Mary Lane and her cousin Claiborne want to sell some land left to them by their family. Real-estate agent Roland Manning falls in love with her, and prepares a deal that will make money for...                See full summary »

14.description: Joan is loved by a young man of the village and they are married. In a few weeks the husband, a soldier, is sent to the war-front along with his three brothers. Word is received that her ...                See full summary »

15.name: Shoes
15.description: A young working girl must suport her family on only five dollars a week. The strain of trying to feed, house and clothe her mother, her father and three brothers finally gets to be too much...                See full summary »

17.name: The Aryan
17.description: Steve Denton, rich from years of prospecting, is fleeced by the citizens of Yellow Ridge. In his rage, he kidnaps the woman most responsible and makes her his slave in a desert hideaway. He...                See full summary »

18.name: The Cossack Whip
18.description: Feodor Turov, chief of the Russian Czar's secret police, orders his Cossacks to attack a village he believes to be infested with rebels. The Cossacks attack the village and massacre almost ...                See full summary »

19.name: East Lynne
19.description: Miscasting of everybody's favorite vamp as the long-suffering Lady Isabel cast in a modern setting.

20.name: Hell's Hinges
20.description: In the wayward western town known as Hell's Hinges, a local tough guy is reformed by the faith of a good woman.

22.name: A Sister of Six
22.description: A young woman and her six little brothers and sisters are left orphans by the murder of their father over gold found on his ranch. Together the seven offspring fight against their greedy ...                See full summary »

23.name: The Devil's Needle
23.description: Wynne Mortimer, a pampered society girl and daughter of William Mortimer, a prominent business man, chances to meet David White, a young artist whose fame is already assured, at an art ...                See full summary »

24.name: Schuhpalast Pinkus
24.description: Sally Pinkus is an German-Jewish boy who takes a job as a shoe store clerk after being expelled from school for goofing around. Soon fired for trying to court the owner's daughter, Pinkus ...                See full summary »

25.name: The Half-Breed
25.description: An outcast named Lo Dorman encounters a young woman lost in the woods. He defends her from danger in the forest and from Sheriff Dunn.

26.name: Homunculus
26.description: A group of scientists, led by a Professor Ortmann, produce a living human child using scientific processes - a "homunculus." This creature is human in every way, except that he cannot experience love.

27.name: Verdens Undergang
27.description: A comet, passing by Earth, causes rioting, social unrest, and major disasters that destroy the world.

28.name: Pikovaya dama
28.description: While hosting a game of cards one night, Narumov tells his friends a story about his grandmother, a Countess. As a young woman, she had once incurred an enormous gambling debt, which she ...                See full summary »

29.name: Gloria's Romance
29.description: An adventurous young girl in Florida gets herself lost in the Everglades and finds terror and excitement, as well as the rivalry of two men in love with her.

30.name: Arms and the Woman
30.description: Rozika is a Hungarian girl who can sing quite nice. She goes to the place known as the United States with her brother whose name happens to be Young Carl. Rozika marries a chap named Trevor...                See full summary »

31.description: First represented in 1896 under the conduction of a 29 year old Toscanini, La Bohème is ever since Puccini's most beloved masterpiece. As Mosco Carner has written, Puccini's La Bohème is ...                See full summary »

32.name: The Dumb Girl of Portici
32.description: Fenella, a poor Italian girl, falls in love with a Spanish nobleman, but their affair triggers a revolution and national catastrophe.

33.name: Homunculus, 1. Teil
33.description: Part of the artificial-creature series encompassing Der Golem (1914 and 1920), Alraune (1918, 1928, 1930) and Metropolis (1926), 'Homunculus' was the most popular serial in Germany during ...                See full summary »

34.name: Pudd'nhead Wilson
34.description: A slave switches her light-skinned baby with her master's baby. The child grows up raised by whites.

37.name: Flirting with Fate
37.description: In the midst of an emotional depression, a man hires a murderer to kill him. But the despair soon passes, and the man must now escape the killer he's hired to end his life.

38.name: The Good Bad Man
38.description: An outlaw calling himself Passin' Through halts his "evil" ways long enough to help out some children in difficulty.

41.name: The Call of the Cumberlands
41.description: A family feud erupts in the mountains of Kentucky.

42.name: Romeo and Juliet
42.description: Shakespeare's classic tale of ill-fated lovers whose deaths bring peace to their warring families.

43.name: Hævnens Nat
43.description: A criminal escapes from prison, however a betrayal leads to his second arrest.

44.name: The Return of Draw Egan

46.name: The Fatal Glass of Beer
46.description: An ex-convict reunites with his father.

47.name: The Sex Lure
47.description: Wealthy capitalist, Clinton Reynolds, and his wife, Laura, have lost their son, Arthur, kidnapped and possibly dead. Attempting to write a wrong in his factory, he adopts the daughter of ...                See full summary »

48.name: The Three Godfathers
48.description: Three outlaws fleeing a posse through the desert come upon a dying woman and her baby in a wagon. Before she passes away, she makes the men promise to take care of her baby and get it safely through the desert.

49.name: Christus
49.description: The story of the life of Christ.
